tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 12, 2025

**Research Topic:** How to consult a scheduled exam in Rio de Janeiro's Sisreg system.

To consult the status of scheduled exams within Rio de Janeiro's Sisreg system, citizens can utilize the "Portal Transpar√™ncia do SISREG Ambulatorial". [1] This portal, accessible via http://smsrio.org/transparencia, provides information on the progress of requests for specialized consultations or exams. [1] The data on this transparency portal is updated weekly, drawing directly from the DataSUS system of the Ministry of Health. [1]

The portal displays data for all pending and returned requests, including those authorized (scheduled) from January 2018 onwards, with details on the date and location of the procedure. [1] It also shows already completed procedures and those with outstanding issues. [1] Priority classifications (red, yellow, green, or blue) are also available, indicating the urgency of the case. [1] For requests not yet fulfilled, the portal provides the average waiting time for the specific procedure. [1]

To check the status of a request, users need to access the portal and use their National Health Card (CNS) number. [1] If a user does not know their CNS number, they should visit their family health clinic to obtain a printed card or the number itself. [1]

Additionally, the "minhasaude.rio" application, developed by the Municipal Health Secretariat of Rio de Janeiro, allows users to track requests and appointments for consultations and surgeries, view vaccination records, and access exam reports. [2] Through the app or its web version, users can monitor their Sisreg requests and their position in the queue. [2]

The Sisreg system itself is a web-based software developed by DATASUS/MS, designed to manage the entire regulatory complex, from primary care to specialized care, aiming to regulate access to SUS health services and improve the efficiency of healthcare resources. [3] The Sisreg III version, in particular, regulates outpatient procedures (consultations and exams) and hospitalizations. [3]

For specific inquiries or issues related to the Sisreg system, users can contact minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br. [4]

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact: Telefone 1746 Consulta SISREG**

The 1746 service is the primary contact channel for the Rio de Janeiro municipality, functioning as an ombudsman ("Ouvidoria") for citizens to submit suggestions, compliments, and complaints regarding municipal services [1]. It provides access to over a thousand public services and information requests [2]. Citizens can reach the 1746 service by dialing 1746 within the municipality or (21) 3460-1746 from other locations; these calls are charged at the rate of a landline call [3]. The service is also available via WhatsApp, and there is a mobile application named "1746 Rio" [3].

SISREG, which stands for Sistema Nacional de Regula√ß√£o (National Regulation System), is a system managed by the Ministry of Health and adopted by the Rio de Janeiro prefecture. Its [1] core function is to regulate access to healthcare services within the Unified Health System (SUS) by managing available slots for medical appointments, specialized exams, and surgeries, thereby optimizing the use of healthcare resources. The [1] SISREG III is a web-based software developed by DATASUS/MS.
 [3]
For citizens wishing to consult the status of their SISREG requests, the official method is through the "Portal de Transpar√™ncia SISREG". This [2] portal can be accessed at the following web address: http://smsrio.org/transparencia. To [2] utilize this portal, individuals must have their Cart√£o Nacional de Sa√∫de (CNS) number. Those who do not know their CNS number can obtain it by visiting their local family health clinic. The [3] transparency portal provides detailed information on the status of requests, including whether they are pending, returned, authorized (scheduled), or completed, as well as their priority classification (red, yellow, green, or blue) and the average waiting time for specific procedures.

While [2] direct consultation of SISREG is conducted via the transparency portal, the 1746 service serves as the official point of contact for all municipal services, including those provided by the Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS). Therefore [1], the 1746 line may offer guidance or information related to health services and the process for consulting SISREG.

The date of this research is August 12, 2025.

**Sources:**
 - [1] https://web2.smsrio.org/subgeral/
 - [2] https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/p/ouvidoria
 - [3] https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br

The process for canceling an appointment with the Rio de Janeiro City Hall depends on the specific service for which the appointment was made. However, general procedures and contact points are available.

- Se o cidad√£o perguntar como √© a ordem de atendimento ao chegar na clinica ou hospital (sem atendimento previamente agendado), explicar que o atendimento √© feito por classifica√ß√£o de risco (processo de triagem), o que significa que os casos mais graves s√£o priorizados.
- Caso o cidad√£o queira consultar o status de um agendamento no SISREG, orientar que acesse a √°rea logada do portal ou aplicativo MinhaSaude.rio, e acesse o menu "SISREG". procedimentos mais complexos s√£o feitos pela rede de sa√∫de estadual e precisam ser consultados no sistema SER. A consulta pode ser feita neste link: https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/transparencia/acesso-a-informacao/2019/07/14-lista-de-espera-regulacao-ser
- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br
- N√£o mandar respostas muito longas e evitar citar termos muito t√©cnicos. Tamb√©m evitar trazer detalhes sobre as regras de neg√≥cio que voc√™ utilizar√° para definir o melhor equipamento. Al√©m disso, evitar mencionar os termos aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, secund√°ria ou terci√°ria.

- Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (CMS): Unidades que podem cobrir parte ou todo o territ√≥rio com equipes de Sa√∫de da Fam√≠lia, tamb√©m atuando na aten√ß√£o b√°sica, com consultas, vacina√ß√£o, pr√©-natal e outros servi√ßos.

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 12, 2025

**Research Topic:** How to obtain a prescription for diabetes medication in Rio de Janeiro.

To obtain medication for diabetes in Rio de Janeiro, individuals should seek treatment within the municipal health network. The Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) of Rio de Janeiro offers a Diabetes Program that provides specialized medical treatment and free medication at Primary Care units [1].

**Procedure for Obtaining Medication:**

1.  **Seek Primary Care:** Individuals should go to the nearest family clinic (cl√≠nica da fam√≠lia) or municipal health center (centro municipal de sa√∫de) for treatment.
2 [1].  **Unit Identification:** To find the appropriate reference unit, one can access the "Onde ser Atendido" link on the SMS website or call the city's central atendimento number, 1746.
3 [1].  **Specialized Medication:** For specialized medications, a medical prescription in two copies is required. The prescription must list the medication by its generic active ingredient and be issued within 90 days (30 days for medications under special control regimes). A detailed medical report describing the patient's clinical condition, diagnosis, and adherence to Ministry of Health protocols is also necessary.
4 [2].  **Insulin and Supplies:** For patients using insulin, the SMS distributes essential supplies such as glucose meters, test strips, lancets, lancet devices, and syringes at Municipal Health Network units. Education [3] on the correct use of syringes is also provided for patients and their caregivers. The [3] distribution of these supplies follows specific protocols, with clinical discretion allowing for adjustments.

 [3]**Farm√°cia Popular Program:**

The federal "Farm√°cia Popular" program also offers access to medications for diabetes. As of February 2025, this program provides 100% free medications and supplies for conditions including hypertension and diabetes, through partnerships with private pharmacies. To utilize [4] this program, individuals need to present their CPF, a photo ID, and a valid medical prescription at a participating pharmacy. Medications [3] for diabetes are among those offered for free under this program.

**General [3] Health Management:**

The Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) manages programs for hypertension and diabetes, aiming for early detection and adequate follow-up to improve quality of life and reduce complications. These [2] programs are implemented in all primary care units across the city. Lifestyle [3] changes, such as healthy eating and physical activity, are emphasized as crucial for managing diabetes. The [1] "Academia Carioca" program, which promotes physical well-being, has shown positive results in helping diabetic participants control blood sugar levels through exercise. [1]

**Sources:**

 - [2] https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/medicamentos/medicamentos-especializados/como-ter-acesso

# N√≠veis de aten√ß√£o da sa√∫de e seus equipamentos

- Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (CMS): Unidades que podem cobrir parte ou todo o territ√≥rio com equipes de Sa√∫de da Fam√≠lia, tamb√©m atuando na aten√ß√£o b√°sica, com consultas, vacina√ß√£o, pr√©-natal e outros servi√ßos.

**Research Artifact: Order of Service at Health Posts in Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 12, 2025

The order of service at health posts and other healthcare facilities in Rio de Janeiro is primarily determined by a system of risk classification, particularly in urgent and emergency care settings. For primary care units, the process involves an initial assessment that guides the scheduling and delivery of services.

**Urgent and Emergency Care:**
In units such as Unidades de Pronto Atendimento (UPAs), Centros de Emerg√™ncia Regional (CERs), and emergency hospitals, the guiding principle for patient care is the **classification of risk**. [1] Upon arrival, patients are evaluated by healthcare professionals who assess their condition individually. Those identified as being in a more severe state are prioritized and receive treatment before patients with less critical conditions, irrespective of their order of arrival. [1] This approach aims to ensure that the most urgent cases are addressed promptly, preventing potential deterioration of health and managing the workload across different healthcare levels. [1]

**Primary Care Units (Health Posts):**
For primary care services, offered at Cl√≠nicas da Fam√≠lia (Family Clinics) and Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (Municipal Health Centers), the process involves an initial assessment and a **classification of risk**. Based [2] on this evaluation, patients may receive care on the same day or have their appointments scheduled, with a maximum waiting period of 30 days. The [2] Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) of Rio de Janeiro is responsible for organizing public health priorities, aligning them with the specific demands of the city's population and established public health policies.

* [3]*Regulatory Systems and Prioritization:**
The State Regulatory System (SER) plays a role in managing access to specialized services and procedures. Within this system, patient prioritization is based on criteria such as the **gravity of the condition and the order of entry into the queue**. This [4] system aims to ensure that patients are directed to appropriate services based on their medical needs and the availability of resources.

* [4]*Specific Prioritization:**
While the classification of risk is the overarching principle, certain groups may receive priority. General guidelines for accessibility in health units mention priority treatment and immediate attention for individuals with disabilities and those with reduced mobility. On [1] a state level, Unidades de Pronto Atendimento (UPAs) managed by the State Health Secretariat have implemented a policy to prioritize individuals over 80 years of age.

The [4] Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) and the Portal Rio 1746 are key official sources for information regarding health services and their operational procedures in Rio de Janeiro. [5]

**Sources:**

 - [4] https://carioca.rio/servicos/atendimento-em-unidades-de-atencao-primaria-em-saude/
 - [5] https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/10733682817307-Unidades-de-Sa%C3%BAde-Municipal

# Orienta√ß√µes de atendimento de acordo com o tipo de classifica√ß√£o:

- Caso o cidad√£o queira consultar o status de um agendamento no SISREG, orientar que acesse a √°rea logada do portal ou aplicativo MinhaSaude.rio, e acesse o menu "SISREG". procedimentos mais complexos s√£o feitos pela rede de sa√∫de estadual e precisam ser consultados no sistema SER. A consulta pode ser feita neste link: https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/transparencia/acesso-a-informacao/2019/07/14-lista-de-espera-regulacao-ser
- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br

- Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (CMS): Unidades que podem cobrir parte ou todo o territ√≥rio com equipes de Sa√∫de da Fam√≠lia, tamb√©m atuando na aten√ß√£o b√°sica, com consultas, vacina√ß√£o, pr√©-natal e outros servi√ßos.

- Centros de Emerg√™ncia Regionais (CERs): Unidades que funcionam ao lado de grandes hospitais e complementam o atendimento de urg√™ncia e emerg√™ncia, com estrutura para casos mais complexos, estabilizando pacientes e filtrando casos para o hospital.
